channel.title: Nature Communications
channel.description:
Nature Communications is an open access, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, health, physical, chemical and Earth sciences. Papers published by the journal aim to represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

We are committed to providing an efficient service for both authors and readers. Our team of independent editors make rapid and fair publication decisions. Prompt dissemination of accepted papers to a wide readership and beyond is achieved through a programme of continuous online publication.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.
channel.prism:copyright: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Signatures of sliding Wigner crystals in bilayer graphene at zero and finite magnetic fields
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 07 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-64587-5

Graphene systems have the potential to host Wigner crystal states at zero magnetic field. Here, the authors report transport signatures consistent with Wigner crystallization in AB-stacked bilayer graphene at both zero and finite magnetic fields.
item.dc:title: Signatures of sliding Wigner crystals in bilayer graphene at zero and finite magnetic fields
item.dc:creator: Anna M. Seiler
Martin Statz
Christian Eckel
Isabell Weimer
Jonas Pöhls
Kenji Watanabe
Takashi Taniguchi
Fan Zhang
R. Thomas Weitz

item.title: GHz-rate optical phase shift in light-matter interaction-engineered, silicon-ferroelectric nematic liquid crystals
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 07 October 2025; doi:10.1038/s41467-025-63924-y

This study demonstrates GHz-speed electro-optic modulation using ferroelectric nematic liquid crystals, offering dual-phase shifting, poling-free operation, low loss, and CMOS compatibility-enabling scalable hybrid silicon-organic photonics.
item.dc:title: GHz-rate optical phase shift in light-matter interaction-engineered, silicon-ferroelectric nematic liquid crystals
item.dc:creator: Iman Taghavi
Omid Esmaeeli
Sheri Jahan Chowdhury
Kashif Masud Awan
